tips.title: Meal Plan
tips.text: Create a meal plan for the week to better track your food spending and freeze food to reheat at work or college.

tips.title: Electricity and Gas
tips.text: Shop around for gas and electricity providers, consider using comparison sites to get the best deal.

tips.title: Payday Loans
tips.text: Avoid Payday loans at all costs, they have high interest rates and there are much better ways to borrow money.

tips.title: Cheap Brands
tips.text: Consider low profile branded goods which are just as good well known branded goods but cost a lot less.

tips.title: Energy Saving Trust
tips.text: The Energy Saving Trust has a free home energy check tool on its website that can save some households Â£250 with its personalised advice. Check it out!

tips.title: Sign up for loyalty cards
tips.text: Sign up for loyalty cards so you can save at the shops you use most.

tips.title: Free Wall Insulation
tips.text: You can get roof and wall insulation for free from certain companies such as British Gas. This can save you heaps of cash in the long run.
